guide.introduction: Pumpkin stencil carving is one of those projects where the results far outweigh the effort. The materials required are cheap, minimal, and easy to find. And luckily, a knack for creativity is optional because you can find dozens of varied stencils online for free.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Pumpkin stencil carving is one of those projects where the results far outweigh the effort. The materials required are cheap, minimal, and easy to find. And luckily, a knack for creativity is optional because you can find dozens of varied stencils online for free.

Relevant parts
  • Pumpkin
  • Tape
  • Candles
Tools
  • Knife
  • Pumpkin-carving tools
  • Spoon
  • X-Acto knife

lines.text: After you’ve chosen your pumpkin, you’ll need to find or create a stencil (search for “pumpkin stencil” online. I found a couple I liked and combined them into one design, seen here). If you’re making your own, just remember that all the parts that won’t be carved out need to connect.
lines.text_raw: After you’ve chosen your pumpkin, you’ll need to find or create a stencil (search for “pumpkin stencil” online. I found a couple I liked and combined them into one design, seen here). If you’re making your own, just remember that all the parts that won’t be carved out need to connect.

lines.text: Cut a lid in your pumpkin and gut it. If the walls are thick, use a serving spoon to scrape away some of the wall where your design will be carved.
lines.text_raw: Cut a lid in your pumpkin and gut it. If the walls are thick, use a serving spoon to scrape away some of the wall where your design will be carved.

steps.title: Fit the stencil onto the pumpkin.

lines.text: Note where your stencil needs to curve to fit the surface. At these points, cut V-shaped notches into the stencil. Tape the design on the pumpkin, bringing the edges of the V’s together so that the stencil fits snugly onto the pumpkin.
lines.text_raw: Note where your stencil needs to curve to fit the surface. At these points, cut V-shaped notches into the stencil. Tape the design on the pumpkin, bringing the edges of the V’s together so that the stencil fits snugly onto the pumpkin.

steps.title: Copy the pattern onto the pumpkin.

lines.text: Punch pinholes around all the edges of the shapes to be cut out. Make the pinholes closely spaced where the cutouts are small and/or detailed.
lines.text_raw: Punch pinholes around all the edges of the shapes to be cut out. Make the pinholes closely spaced where the cutouts are small and/or detailed.

lines.text: Remove the pattern and begin carving. Carve small areas first to preserve stability of the pumpkin wall.
lines.text_raw: Remove the pattern and begin carving. Carve small areas first to preserve stability of the pumpkin wall.

lines.text: Aim the carving tool straight into the pumpkin — angling it can compromise the look of your design.
lines.text_raw: Aim the carving tool straight into the pumpkin — angling it can compromise the look of your design.

lines.text: Go slowly on long cuts to avoid getting off track.
lines.text_raw: Go slowly on long cuts to avoid getting off track.

lines.text: Stock up on candles to show off your masterpiece.
lines.text_raw: Stock up on candles to show off your masterpiece.

lines.text: If you don’t like your design wilting along with your pumpkin, try an artificial pumpkin (try http://www.funkins.com) next year so you can admire it forever.
